Job ID: 2301230...Location:.SAN DIEGO , CA , US...Date Posted:.2023-01-26...Category:.Engineering and Sciences...Subcategory:.Systems Engineer...Schedule:.Full-time...Shift:.Day Job...Travel:.Yes, 10 % of the Time...Minimum Clearance Required:.TS/SCI...Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain:.None...Potential for Remote Work:.No...Description.....SAIC is looking for a Test and Evaluation System Engineer in San Diego, CA.....Engineer will support PEO C4I Programs and Projects and has an active Top Secret / SCI clearance to start work. The candidate will act in multiple roles as Tester, including technical support liaison. The candidate will also provide support to Operational Test and Evaluation (OT&E) for rapid software development of PEO C4I systems.....Job duties and responsibilities may include any of the following:...Develop, design, and execute operational test as well as the analysis of test data after operational test is complete.   Support statistical analysis using performance specifications and other requirements/acquisition documentation.   Test and Evaluation event support including Developmental Test (DT) and Maintenance Demonstration (M-DEMO) events at contractor sites, as well as Operational Test (OT).   Understand and be able to develop a master Information Operations (IO) test strategy and associated implementation efforts which help drive information systems into the next generation, improving the user experience across the Navy warfighting community.   Understand and be able to execute a test strategy, ensuring all Key Performance Parameters (KPPs) are executed correctly with objectives and thresholds results observed and recorded.   Collaborate with system Lead Engineers across the NAVWAR/PEO C4I community of interest in drafting Engineering Change Requests (ECR) for review and approval at the Platform Technical Review Board (PTRB).   Execute various levels of tests and evaluate risk, providing risk mitigation and action plans to executive leadership that may impact project goals and/or objectives.   Considered a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in drafting various types of test documentation, such as; test charter, master test plan, test objectives, test procedures, user guide, system installation guide, system administration guide and standard operational verification test procedures for peer review and signature.   Understand the requirements to execute multiple test events on a variety of networks within the Navy that include ONE-Net, ISNS, CANES, TACLAN and TACMobile.   Considered a SME in executing the Adaptive Acquisition Framework/Software Acquisition Pathway (AAF/SWP) test strategy.   Understand the relationship between Operational Test and Evaluation Forces (OPTEVFOR), Joint Interoperability Test Command (JITC), and OPNAV, on how the coordination between those organizations apply to Developmental Test and Evaluation (DT&E), Integration Test and Evaluation (IT&E), Initial Operational Test and Evaluation (IOT&E) and Follow-on Test and Evaluation (FOT&E).   Understand how the Trade Agreement Act of 1979 limits various hardware from connecting to various networks.   Understand and be proficient in completing the Service Request Form (SRF), Operational Survey (OPS Survey) and Test Readiness Review (TRR) in order to enter into a NAVWAR test event.   Understand the relationship with an automated test framework and the objective quality evidence to support T&E objectives....Qualifications.....Required Education & Experience: TS/SCI. Bachelors and nine (9) years or more experience; Masters and seven (7) years or more experience; PhD and 4 years related experience....5+ years' experience as a Test Engineer, or OPTEVFOR Test and Evaluation (T&E) experience, and related statistical analysis experience. Understand data collection plans and data analysis, systems engineering concepts and related systems engineering processes.   Knowledge of DOD/ U.S. Navy acquisition documents and OPTEVFOR publications.   T&E Level I certified and a member in good standing with the DAU DAWIA T&E Community of Interest.   Use Microsoft Office Suite applications....Required Skills:...Ability to operate both independently and without direct supervision and in a collaborative software development lab environment...Security Clearance:...TS/SCI with Current SSBI...Desired Skills and Certifications:...Understanding PEO C4I, NAVWAR, US Navy C-ISR systems and CONOPS   Prior Military (Navy) experience....Target salary range: $125,001 - $135,000. The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors....Covid Policy: SAIC does not require COVID-19 vaccinations or boosters. Customer site vaccination requirements must be followed when work is performed at a customer site.SAICÂ® is a premier Fortune 500Â® technology integrator driving our nation's technology transformation. Our robust portfolio of offerings across the defense, space, civilian, and intelligence markets includes secure high-end solutions in engineering, digital, artificial intelligence, and mission solutions. Using our expertise and understanding of existing and emerging technologies, we integrate the best components from our own portfolio and our partner ecosystem to deliver innovative, effective, and efficient solutions that are critical to achieving our customers' missions....We are approximately 26,000 strong; driven by mission, united by purpose, and inspired by opportunities. SAIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer, fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion , which is core to our values and important to attract and retain exceptional talent. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, SAIC has annual revenues of approximately $7.4 billion. For more information, visit saic.com . For ongoing news, please visit our newsroom ...My SAIC Benefits.

output: Job Requirements:- TS/SCI clearance- Bachelor's degree and 9 years of experience, Master's degree and 7 years of experience, or PhD and 4 years of related experience- 5 years of experience as a Test Engineer or OPTEVFOR Test and Evaluation (T&E) experience, and related statistical analysis experience- Knowledge of DOD/U.S. Navy acquisition documents and OPTEVFOR publications- T&E Level I certified and a member in good standing with the DAU DAWIA T&E Community of Interest- Ability to operate independently and without direct supervision and in a collaborative software development lab environment- Desired skills and certifications include understanding PEO C4I, NAVWAR, US Navy C-ISR systems and CONOPS, and prior military (Navy) experience.

### Job_Dedcrip:
Overview.....Our Team....Technology Services Group (TSG).powers BNY Mellon by providing scale, capacity and capability to deliver the critical technology required to operate the global financial services markets.....TSG is defined by three core values:...Creative innovators, delivering excellence and simplicity Always doing the right thing for the bank, colleagues and clients Fostering a collaborative, diverse and inclusive environment, where we challenge each other to execute as one TSG team...As part of TSG, Our Architecture & Engineering team defines enterprise technology architecture and engineering principles and best practices. We develop next-generation engineering solutions focused on Resiliency and Innovation. We engineer and integrate the critical systems and platforms used across the bank and with external clients....The Role....Senior Principal, Data Architect....Key Responsibilities...Researches and implements corporate data management strategy to improve the company's advantage in the marketplace. Strategizes and contributes to enterprise level technological initiatives on data governance, management and usage.  Develop and articulate actionable target state data architectures and roadmaps in support of enterprise data management strategies, including but not limited to data lake, data master, data distribution & consumption architecture patterns Ensures high quality delivery of the company's data architecture and data administrative solutions and services. Provides enterprise data architecture planning, design and deployment in business solutions. Defines architecture and design in accordance with architecture principles. Adheres to established architecture methodologies and standards and ensures compliance with company policy. Identifies organization-wide initiatives and makes recommendations for the use of technology. Performs enterprise planning and designing solutions for emerging business and complex technology environments. Identifies and recommends ways to drive more value out of the company's technology assets. Engages with business and operations SMEs to ensure data architectures support business capability and operational process improvements Designs stable and flexible high-performance solutions, maximizing reuse and avoiding redundancy. Works with other stakeholders in optimizing architecture solutions. Works with the enterprise business architects, application architects, database architects and technology architects for deploying technology solutions Oversees architecture activities of the organization to assure the strategic goals of the organization are met, including coordinating all required procedures, technical artifacts and approvals. Provides mentoring to other architects and leads peer reviews of architecture artifacts Works closely with senior management to educate and to articulate resource requirements necessary to promote architecture goals. Contributes to the achievement of multiple teams' objectives....This is a Talent Pipeline Requisition...BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Our ambition is to build the best global team - one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve - and to empower our team to do their best work. We support wellbeing and a balanced life, and offer a range of family-friendly, inclusive employment policies and employee forums....BNY Mellon assesses market data to ensure a competitive compensation package for our employees. The base salary for this position is expected to be between $131,500 and $260,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base salary if hired will be determined on an individualized basis, including as to experience and market location, and is only part of the BNYM total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, discretionary bonuses, short and long-term incentive packages, and Company-sponsored benefit programs...This position is at-will and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, change in geographic location, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors....Employer Description:...For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments and safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart. Make your mark: bnymellon.com/careers....EEO Statement:...BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Our ambition is to build the best global team - one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve - and to empower our team to do their best work. and Tasks:...Consults and collaborates with business leaders, end user, IT staff, vendors, and other third parties and is involved in every phase of application development lifecyclePredominately the ### Job_Dedcrip:
Overview.....Our Team....Technology Services Group (TSG).powers BNY Mellon by providing scale, capacity and capability to deliver the critical technology required to operate the global financial services markets.....TSG is defined by three core values:...Creative innovators, delivering excellence and simplicity Always doing the right thing for the bank, colleagues and clients Fostering a collaborative, diverse and inclusive environment, where we challenge each other to execute as one TSG team...As part of TSG, Our Architecture & Engineering team defines enterprise technology architecture and engineering principles and best practices. We develop next-generation engineering solutions focused on Resiliency and Innovation. We engineer and integrate the critical systems and platforms used across the bank and with external clients....The Role....Senior Principal, Data Architect....Key Responsibilities...Researches and implements corporate data management strategy to improve the company's advantage in the marketplace. Strategizes and contributes to enterprise level technological initiatives on data governance, management and usage.  Develop and articulate actionable target state data architectures and roadmaps in support of enterprise data management strategies, including but not limited to data lake, data master, data distribution & consumption architecture patterns Ensures high quality delivery of the company's data architecture and data administrative solutions and services. Provides enterprise data architecture planning, design and deployment in business solutions. Defines architecture and design in accordance with architecture principles. Adheres to established architecture methodologies and standards and ensures compliance with company policy. Identifies organization-wide initiatives and makes recommendations for the use of technology. Performs enterprise planning and designing solutions for emerging business and complex technology environments. Identifies and recommends ways to drive more value out of the company's technology assets. Engages with business and operations SMEs to ensure data architectures support business capability and operational process improvements Designs stable and flexible high-performance solutions, maximizing reuse and avoiding redundancy. Works with other stakeholders in optimizing architecture solutions. Works with the enterprise business architects, application architects, database architects and technology architects for deploying technology solutions Oversees architecture activities of the organization to assure the strategic goals of the organization are met, including coordinating all required procedures, technical artifacts and approvals. Provides mentoring to other architects and leads peer reviews of architecture artifacts Works closely with senior management to educate and to articulate resource requirements necessary to promote architecture goals. Contributes to the achievement of multiple teams' objectives....This is a Talent Pipeline Requisition...BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Our ambition is to build the best global team - one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve - and to empower our team to do their best work. We support wellbeing and a balanced life, and offer a range of family-friendly, inclusive employment policies and employee forums....BNY Mellon assesses market data to ensure a competitive compensation package for our employees. The base salary for this position is expected to be between $131,500 and $260,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base salary if hired will be determined on an individualized basis, including as to experience and market location, and is only part of the BNYM total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, discretionary bonuses, short and long-term incentive packages, and Company-sponsored benefit programs...This position is at-will and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, change in geographic location, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors....Employer Description:...For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments and safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart. Make your mark: bnymellon.com/careers....EEO Statement:...BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Our ambition is to build the best global team - one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve - and to empower our team to do their best work. We support wellbeing and a balanced life, and offer a range of family-friendly, inclusive employment policies and employee forums.

### Job_Dedcrip:
ISSM - On site in Beautiful Coastal California...This Jobot Job is hosted by: Melanie McSweeney..Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the Apply Now button and sending us your resume...Salary: $140,000 - $160,000 per year...A bit about us:...Non-profit 'Think Tank' research organization that develops solutions to public policy challenges to help make communities throughout the world safer and more secure, healthier and more prosperous...Why join us?...Great Benefits that start Day 1!..Medical, Dental, Vision..9 paid holidays..20 Days of PTO per year..9 sick days per year..Wellness Programs..Health Flex Spending Account..Dependent Car Flex Spending Account..https://jobot.com/apply/information-systems-security-manager/1015806205?utm_source=Dice - care.com..Short Term and Long Term Disability..Maternity, Parent, Caregiver Leave..Life Insurance..Adoption Assistance Reimbursement..Tuition Reimbursement..401(a) - 20% vested after 2 years, 50% after 3 years, %100 vested after 4 years...Job Details...This position is 100% on site...Security Clearance...Must possess and maintain a Top Secret U.S. government security clearance, or if Top Secret U.S. government security clearance is no longer active, must have possessed a Top Secret U.S. government security clearance within the past 24 months...Experience...A minimum of six years' relevant experience required. Nine years relevant experience preferred...Qualifications...In-depth knowledge of the NISPOM (32 CFR, Part 117), DCID/ICD documents and applicable government security regulation experience in classified security government programs. Ability to obtain and maintain a DoD 8570.01-M (Information Assurance Workforce) IAM level 2 certification (e.g., GSLC, CISM, or CISSP) within the first 6 months of employment.  Established relationships and a positive reputation with industrial and government security counterparts. An understanding of principles and methods used in developing, establishing, and maintaining a local, state, and federal government compliant program in classified security.  Thorough knowledge of information security systems and the classified network. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Must be able to pass a background check...Duties...Performs the ISSM responsibilities and role for collateral classified networks, TS/SCI, and SAP/SAR activities for the Santa Monica site; performs oversight administration of classified systems activities.  Performs computer systems security activities, implementing security controls for Santa Monica systems processing classified information including initial approval, re-approval, decertification, and audits with responsibility for the Santa Monica site. Coordinates with the Defense Intelligence Agency and other elements of the U.S. intelligence community on inspections, reviews, investigations, and other reportable issues; coordinates with the Defense Counterintelligence and Security Service (DCSA) and Department of Defense sponsors on inspections, reviews, investigations, and other reportable issues.  Responsible for the classified computing protection program at the collateral, TS/SCI, and SAP/SAR levels for the Santa Monica site, as well as the classified computing hardware/software and voice/data communication audits.  Supports the FSO as related to classified processing for maintaining secure facility accreditations and joint and co-use agreements with applicable government agencies.  Writes, coordinates, and conducts classified systems security education briefings (SAP, SCI, and CLAN) and the User Acknowledgment statement as required. Supports the Manager, Security Administration in maintaining detailed records of Security department functions and activities for monthly reports to management regarding classified systems; conducts classified security investigations as required by the Manager, Security Administration.  Other duties and special projects as assigned...Education...High School Diploma or GED equivalency required BA/BS degree highly preferred...Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.""

### Job_Dedcrip:
This is a hybrid-based position and will require time in office as needed....At Cox Communications, we're searching for a.Lead Cloud Automation Engineer.to handle all things cloud infrastructure, from design to implementation. If you're all about technologies within enterprise cloud environments and virtualization, we want to meet you. Our team provides IaaS, PaaS, AWS, and Google Cloud Platform platforms to our internal customers....What You'll Do...You'll develop solutions for a virtual cloud environment and identify opportunities for automation. Here's a look at how you'll spend your day:...Designing, implementing, maintaining, monitoring and supporting virtualization platforms.  Employing DevOps principles and tools to automate processes.  Participating in cross-functional projects as a virtualization infrastructure subject matter expert.  Troubleshooting and resolving complex technical issues.  Performing lifecycle management and capacity planning for virtualization platforms.  Documenting designs, policies and procedures.  Training and mentoring team members.  Creating automated reports  Keeping up-to-date on new technologies and training.  Assisting with strategic direction by providing input on new technologies, best practices and procedures.  Participating in 24x7 on-call support rotation.  Help your team and organization succeed...Who You Are...You're a virtualization and automation expert with a passion for technology. You're familiar with industry standards, best practices, tools, and procedures for technologies within enterprise cloud environments. Here are some requirements:...Minimum:...Bachelor's degree in a related discipline and 6 years' experience in a related field. The right candidate could also have a different combination, such as a master's degree and 4 years' experience; a Ph.D. and 1 year of experience  7+ years of experience with VMware as an engineer or administrator in a large enterprise environment.  Proficiency with scripting and coding.  Proficiency in system analysis, design and optimization.  Proficiency with executing projects through traditional methodologies.  Excellent analytical, problem-solving, communication, and planning skills.  Ability to work in a team...Preferred:...Experience with Kubernetes and Docker.  Public cloud experience (AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Azure).  A bachelor's degree or equivalent in computer science, information technology, business information systems or related field.  An engineering background....What's In It For You?...Our lives contain a lot of moving parts. At Cox, our best-in-class benefits package and award-winning employee culture give you peace of mind, knowing that you and your family have a wide range of options for the best care available....We all have lives and responsibilities outside of work, and we respect that. We have an exceptional work/life balance at Cox, with accommodating work schedules and flexible time-off policies.  Our talent is paid what they're worth with a competitive salary package and top-notch bonus & incentive plans.  We help you prepare for the future with a 401(k) (that we'll generously match), life insurance and disability insurance.  You'll enjoy a generous suite of healthcare benefits with various deductible options, along with pharmacy benefits, Flexible Spending Account & Health Savings Account options, counseling for mental wellness and more.  Looking to grow your family? Rest assured you'll have access to our inclusive parental leave policies, plus comprehensive fertility coverage and adoption assistance.  Want to volunteer in your community? We encourage that, and even offer paid hours for you to do so.  Our employees enjoy discounts on computers, entertainment, travel and more.  Continuing education and professional development are important, and at Cox we offer both.  We all love our pets-whether they walk, crawl, fly, swim or slither-and we're happy to supply insurance for them as well....Believe it or not, there's even more than that! We have a veritable smorgasbord of benefits at Cox, giving you the freedom to pick and choose what works best for you and your family....Realize your goals. Apply today!...#LI-102...About Cox Communications...Cox Communications is the largest private telecom company in America, serving six million homes and businesses. That's a lot, but we also proudly serve our employees. Our benefits and our award-winning culture are just two of the things that make Cox a coveted place to work. If you're interested in bringing people closer through broadband, smart home tech and more, join Cox Communications today!...About Cox...Cox empowers employees to build a better future and has been doing so for over 120 years. With exciting investments and innovations across transportation, communications, cleantech and healthcare, our family of businesses - which includes Cox Automotive and Cox Communications - is forging a better future for us all. Ready to make your mark? Join us today!...Benefits of working at Cox may include health care insurance (medical, dental, vision), retirement planning (401(k)), and paid days off (sick leave, parental leave, flexible vacation/wellness days, and/or PTO). For more details on what benefits you may be offered, visit our benefits page ....Cox is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer - All qualified applicants/employees will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individual's age, race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law....Statement to ALL Third-Party Agencies and Similar Organizations: Cox accepts resumes only from agencies with which we formally engage their services. Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, Cox employees, Cox hiring manager, or send to any Cox facility. Cox is not responsible for any fees or charges associated with unsolicited resumes.

### Response:
output: Job Requirements:- Bachelor's degree in a related discipline and 6 years' experience in a related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience- 7 years of experience with VMware as an engineer or administrator in a large enterprise environment- Proficiency with scripting and coding- Proficiency in system analysis, design and optimization- Proficiency with executing projects through traditional methodologies- Excellent analytical, problem-solving, communication, and planning skills- Ability to work in a team- Experience with Kubernetes and Docker (preferred)- Public cloud experience (AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Azure) (preferred)- A bachelor's degree or equivalent in computer science, information technology, business information systems or related field (preferred)- An engineering background (preferred)

Today, we-re approximately 50,000 employees across 35 countries with a culture that empowers you to grow, take risks, experiment and be yourself. and execute against the product roadmap, play a key role in the product planning process   Work closely with engineers in laying out and designing system architecture to align with product objectives and ensure successful delivery on time and with high quality   Manage engineering backlog, define user stories, help unblock engineers by making product and technical decisions   Research and dive deep into the blockchain ecosystem and technology to understand and define new features and products   Track and report on progress of features and product performance with key stakeholders....Preferred Skills:....5+ years of experience as a Product Manager on technical products   Strategic thinker with strong analytics, structured thinking, and problem-solving skills other blockchain projects   Experience working in full stack web development and/or app development and contribute to codebase   Strong knowledge of Smart Contract development and related technologies in a related discipline or equivalent work   experience required; advanced degree is beneficial   10-12 years of related experience required; experience in the securities or financial services industry a plus...#LI-Hybrid....BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.....Minorities/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans. However, base salary if hired will be determined on an individualized basis, including as to experience and market location, and is only part of the BNYM total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, discretionary bonuses, short and long-term incentive packages, and Company-sponsored benefit programs....This position is at-will and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, change in geographic location, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors....Employer Description:...For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments and safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart. ...Flexion is seeking a Senior Lean UX Researcher/Designer to join a cross functional agile development team.....Why you want to work at Flexion:..Flexion pursues and wins work that improves people's lives, and we know that sustained success comes from creating a fun culture that enables and trusts our people. We empower people and teams to manage themselves by hiring people who can solve complex problems through collaboration, and by providing expert peer coaching. This means lending a hand and flexing your multi-skilled muscles as needed. Every member within Flexion's teams is a leader who takes responsibility for the team's success, which mirrors the company's low-bureaucracy structure.....What the job looks like:..As a member of a cross-functional agile development team, you'll partner with our clients to tackle holistic business and user problems. You'll help build HCD thinking into everything the team does...Specifically, you'll:..Lead and facilitate continuous discovery and research to understand needs, goals, constraints, and generate insights that shape the user experience.Lead and facilitate frequent design workshops using methods such as the "Design Studio Method" or other collaborative methods.Iteratively perform and coach sketching, prototyping, creating mockups, testing, and iterating on designs.Lead and facilitate and analyze client and user feedback to identify opportunities to improve the overall user experience throughout the product lifecycle.Lead and facilitate content audits, heuristic reviews, user journeys, card sorting, creating personas, modeling workflows, information architecture.Effectively communicate goals, designs, research, feedback, ideas, and requirements (both verbally and visually, when needed) to client stakeholders.Facilitate and coach other team members on basic Web Accessibility Standards.Drive the development and enhancement of reusable design systems.Pair or mob with other members of a cross-functional development team.....Flexion is a remote first company. It is imperative that you have a reliable internet connection. We rely on Zoom for meetings and communications. We strive to balance "heads down" time with active engagement and find "cameras on" can help our teams be present and build relationships. Some travel to client sites may be requested. You must reside in the United States of America.....Why we want to hire you:..You have a passion for using and coaching human centered design techniques and Lean UX methods. You iteratively and incrementally drive learning and development by embracing agile methodologies. You excel at designing small pieces, while still thinking about how they fit into the whole...You love solving big business and user problems. You can balance high-level strategy with detail-oriented tactics. You're just as at home leading a discovery session with C-level executives as you are sketching prototype ideas in a design studio session. You actively co-create designs and solutions throughout the process...You're a self-starter and don't need to be told what to do next. You have a wide range of UX-related skills and can flex different muscles as required. You value consistency-but also know when to customize user experiences to improve usability. You value data-driven decision-making, but won't become paralyzed if the data doesn't exist...You are eager to lend a hand with testing, documentation, or other tasks needed to get the product in front of users quickly. You love working collaboratively, sharing knowledge and learning from others across your team and the greater Flexion ecosystem. You aren't afraid to step up to help the organization when you see a need.....You have:..At least 8 recent years working on UX designs for clientsAt least 4 recent years experience working with agile methodologiesAt least 4 recent years of Lean UX experience working with agile methodologiesA bias toward performing research and design work collaboratively with other developers and stakeholdersA "can do" attitude devoid of egoSuccessfully coached teams and clientsSuperb time-management, communication, and problem-solving skillsExperience leading and facilitate user interviewsExperience analyzing, drawing, and sharing insights from interview data.Experience designing for complex data systems and enterprise applicationsExperience facilitating and leading usability testsExperience designing and documenting user interactions and user flowsExperience designing prototypes at varying levels of fidelity; sometimes on-the-flyExperience using prototyping tools such as a pen/napkin, Mural, Adobe Creative Suite, Invision, FIgma, etc.Using workflow and modeling tools such as Mural, LucidChart, etcKnowledge of responsive design principles and 508/accessibility compliance standardsA bachelor's degree or equivalent experience....At Flexion, we live by these principles:..Speak openly and honestly with your colleagues and clients about problems and proposed solutionsWelcome and handle changing requirements and priorities with little or no warningCollaborate online in small groups about 50% of the timeEncourage simple and minimal solutions that keep options openExpect and vocally advocate for quality firstLearn new practices and techniques as the situation demandsEnsure the teams develop demonstrable software every week or twoDo what needs to be done to deliver the product or project without ego or attitudeDig deep to find the root causes of problems so we can create the right solutionsRelentlessly improve yourself, your team, and your processes....The most efficient way to reach our recruiting team is to submit your resume through the URL provided.....Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer..If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us atfor assistance.....Required Skills:..""

### Response:
output: At least 8 recent years working on UX designs for clientsAt least 4 recent years experience working with agile methodologiesAt least 4 recent years of Lean UX experience working with agile methodologiesA bias toward performing research and design work collaboratively with other developers and stakeholdersSuccessfully coached teams and clientsSuperb time-management, communication, and problem-solving skillsExperience leading and facilitate user interviewsExperience analyzing, drawing, and sharing insights from interview data.Experience designing for complex data systems and enterprise applicationsExperience facilitating and leading usability testsExperience designing and documenting user interactions and user flowsExperience designing prototypes at varying levels of fidelity; sometimes on-the-flyExperience using prototyping tools such as a pen/napkin, Mural, Adobe Creative Suite, Invision, FIgma, etc.Using workflow and modeling tools such as Mural, LucidChart, etcKnowledge of responsive design principles and 508/accessibility compliance standardsA bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.

input:
### Job_Dedcrip:
MATERIAL COORDINATOR FOR LIGHT INDUSTRIAL     WARREN, NJ....This is an Onsite role!     The pay rate is $31.00 to $35.51 an hour!      Required Skills:..Bachelor's degree and 3 years of applicable Pharma experience; an equivalent combination of education, experience and training may substitute.       Must have a valid driver's license.       Ability to work as team.      Intermediate written and verbal communication and mathematical skills.      Introductory Proficiency in MS Office applications.       Inventory control and management including lot / batch segregation, expiration dating, and temperature storage requirements.       Advanced warehouse management system experience.      Communication and initiation of production deviations and assistance with quality investigations are required, as applicable.        Overtime may be required at management discretion including on weekends.       Background to include an understanding of biology, chemistry, medical or clinical practices preferred, not required.      ERP experience preferred, not required...Working Conditions (US Only):       Must be able to work in a cleanroom environment and perform aseptic processing.       Must have the ability to work around laboratories and controlled, enclosed, restricted areas.       Ability to crouch, bend, twist, and reach.      Physical dexterity sufficient to use computers and documentation.       Must be able to work in Lab setting with biohazards/ various chemicals/ strong magnets.       Ability to stand /sit/walk for long periods of time and work different hours of the day.       Ability to lift/ push/ pull 50 lbs. independently.      Must be able to perform activities with repetitive motions.       Must be able to wear clean room garments and personal protective equipment (PPE).       Must be comfortable being exposed to human blood components.       Maintain manufacturing environmental conditions (Non-Viable Particulate(s) and Viable microbial levels per controlled area classification specifications) by performing area disinfection regiment as required to meet global Health Authority requirements.       Must be comfortable in a clean room environment, which is an enclosed, restricted space, with assigned pressure and temperature conditions.        Reagents, chemicals, and exposure to sanitization agents are expected.       Based on work assignment, may be recommended (or required) to have medical and visual screening testing in accordance with the company's Occupational Health Program...Project Description:..Manages cold chain and patient material receipt, release, dispensing, inventory, and shipping for CAR-T production per Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) in controlled and/or classified environments under the supervision of Supply Chain Operations Management.        The position must adhere to regulatory requirements while performing job functions.       Job duties are performed in alignment with CAR-T production schedules, may require weekend work.        Records patient material handling / operations data and information in a clear, concise, format according to proper cGxP requirements.       Performs inspection and receipt of incoming patient materials per cold chain shipping requirements in coordination with defined specifications and in collaboration with Incoming Quality Control.       Performs inventory control - cycle counts, material stocking, scrapping, destruction.       Completes inventory / material transfer and movement within facility.       Manages material expiry, lot / batch control, allocation and maintains material condition requirements.       Maintains timing according to the production schedule to ensure on-time material transfers and availability.       Completes transactions within an electronic data management system, i.e., Oracle.       Performs inspection and receipt of incoming Apheresis and PBMC and prepares final product shipments for couriers.      Quantifies and maintains materials in production dispensary.       Perform apheresis receipt of incoming raw materials and prepares final product shipments for couriers.       Maintains timing according to the production schedule to ensure on-time logistics.       Records material handling data and information in a clear, concise, format according to proper GDPs.       Works in a team based, cross-functional environment to complete warehousing tasks required by shift schedule.       Must be able to work in an environment with blood derived components.       Completes training requirements in accordance to defined schedule / curricula.      Periodically reviews and provides input on revisions to SOPs related to functional responsibilities.       Provides support for investigations and issue resolution.       Assists with resolution of inbound issues (receiving, suspect damages, shipment errors).       Identifies process and performance improvement opportunities.      Collaborates cross functionally with Manufacturing, Quality, Materials Management, Process & Technology.      Other duties may be assigned, as necessary...This 12+ month position starts ASAP.   Please E-MAIL your resume (attachment to email) with rate and availability to Maureen:       ALPHA'S REQUIREMENT #23-00286   MUST BE ELIGIBLE TO WORK IN THE U.S. AS AN HOURLY W2 EMPLOYEE

### Job_Dedcrip:
We are looking for a Tier 1 Technician who is primarily responsible for working on a team at the Service Desk. The Tier 1 Technician is primarily responsible for working on a team at the Service Desk. This position will handle technical support requests directly from customers as well as escalation from other team members and field engineers. Our engineers are responsible for maintaining user uptime and improving their computing experiences through effective maintenance, problem identification and resolution activities, as well as growing and developing the organization's perception with existing customers through exceptional customer service....Primary Position Tasks:..Email Administration with basic level of user management including configuring new accounts, password resets, and troubleshooting user login, profile, and permission issuesMaintaining standards and documentation on an ongoing basis as products and technologies evolveAccept customer calls, alerts, and escalations from the Level 1 operations team within specified timeframes.Follow trouble shooting Standards Operating Procedures (SOPs)Act as the point of contact for customer incidents reported by telephone, email and remote monitoring tools ensuring all processes and agreed upon standards are followed. This includes performing system analysis techniques to consult with end users and determining the hardware and software system functional specifications.Consistently meet/exceed customer account needs; identify opportunities to enhance delivery of company service and support goals.Engage in IT certification programs to develop subject matter expertiseWork independently with a focused direction while adding value and contributing to overall team performance.Maintain accuracy of all reports/audits and client documentation based on Red River and customer defined system specifications. Ensure log entries to the ticketing system are accurate, concise, and timely to meet the SLAs (service-level agreement).Maintain case ownership and keep customers informed of progress on their issues by contacting them periodically with updates.Exercise sound judgment when working outside defined practices and procedures; accurately close incidents for known errors without the need for functional escalationEscalate potential areas for improvement to standard operating procedures (SOPs) to team leadership.Keep current on new releases, updates, and changes to Customer Run Book contentContinually pursue on-going training and development opportunities to advance skill sets and, in turn, ability to effectively deliver to customers.Maintain clear understanding of the interdependencies that problem, change, and configuration managements processes have on good incidents management practices.Act as a mentor to Level 1 Customer Service Representatives.Responsibilities aligned with managing area of your team tier alignmentProvide after hours on call support as requiredOther business duties as assigned...Minimum Education/Certification/Experience Requirements:..Bachelor's degree desired, Computer Science, Engineering or other technical degree or equivalent experienceDesired certifications: CompTIA A+, Network+, OR Microsoft MCSA certifications.Minimum 1 years of IT experience with IT administration and support experience with windows administration and management of Active Directory, DHCP, DNS, Group policy.High level experience and knowledge of Windows and Mac operating systems...Preferred Education/Certification/Experience:..Previous Experience in a fast-paced consulting or MSP environment as plus Basic domain functionality experience with Active Directory functionalities, Group Policy, DNS, and DHCPExperience with desktop operating systems...Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:..Basic knowledge of Backup SolutionsBasic knowledge of troubleshooting Remote Desktop Services and VPNBasic understanding of core network componentsBasic virtualization Administration and architecture knowledge such as rebooting virtual machines, allocating necessary resources, and maintaining the hypervisorCandidates must be energetic and focused with a strong motivation to learn new technologies and management and maintenance processes..This position requires dedication, persistence, effective utilization of provided resources and the ability to deliver superior customer service.Proven ability to utilize CRM data, product documentation and other resources to research and resolve client technical issues.IT hardware/software knowledge with previous work experience in Windows and Unix/Linux-based environmentsStrong understanding of hardware and software compatibility (i.e., rev. levels, firmware, versions, etc.), installation, and configurationStrong working knowledge of servers (physical and virtual), enterprise backup applications, SAN, and network infrastructureStrong consulting and communication skills Confidence and experience in front of clients Strong ability to work in a team-based environment Ability to be a self-starter and possess good time management skills...Red River offers a competitive salary, excellent benefits and an exceptional work environment. You can review our benefit offerings.here.. If you are ready to join a growing company, please submit your resume and cover letter (optional)....EOE M/F/DISABLED/Vet...Red River is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, family medical history or genetic information, disability, past or present military service, or any other characteristics protected under the laws applicable in the locations where Red River operates.  Red River will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics....Red River does not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters or third party recruiting agencies in response to job postings or otherwise. Placement fees will not be paid to any recruiter unless Red River has an active agreement in place with the recruiter and such a request has been made by the Red River Talent Acquisition team and such candidate was submitted to the Red River Talent Acquisition Team via our Applicant Tracking System. Any unsolicited resumes or other data submitted to Red River in violation of this policy may be used by Red River without obligation to pay any fees of any kind to the recruiter.

### Response:
output: Job Requirements:- Bachelor's degree desired, Computer Science, Engineering or other technical degree or equivalent experience- Desired certifications: CompTIA A, Network, OR Microsoft MCSA certifications- Minimum 1 years of IT experience with IT administration and support experience with windows administration and management of Active Directory, DHCP, DNS, Group policy- High level experience and knowledge of Windows and Mac operating systems- Basic domain functionality experience with Active Directory functionalities, Group Policy, DNS, and DHCP- Basic knowledge of Backup Solutions- Basic knowledge of troubleshooting Remote Desktop Services and VPN- Basic understanding of core network components- Basic virtualization Administration and architecture knowledge such as rebooting virtual machines, allocating necessary resources, and maintaining the hypervisor- IT hardware/software knowledge with previous work experience in Windows and Unix/Linux-based environments- Strong understanding of hardware and software compatibility (i.e., rev. levels, firmware, versions, etc.), installation, and configuration- Strong working knowledge of servers (physical and virtual), enterprise backup applications, SAN, and network infrastructure- Strong consulting and communication skills- Confidence and experience in front of clients- Strong ability to work in a team-based environment- Ability to be a self-starter and possess good time management skills

### Job_Dedcrip:
Company..Federal Reserve Bank of Boston...This job's responsibilities include playing a lead role monitoring FSO's critical applications EASy and AMI, participating in risk management/information security activities, incident management/communications, and liaison to NIT and other FR business lines relative to environmental software upgrades and interfaces. The position also participates in contingency planning/testing and other resiliency initiatives. This is a remote role, You will work remotely from your home office. You agree to have the appropriate office set up to support your full engagement and protection of Federal Reserve information. You also agree to travel as needed to attend necessary business and team meetings in support of the successful delivery of the FSO CATS program....Principal Responsibilities...The Lead Systems Analyst is a member of the FSO CATS Production Team.  The team is expanding operations from five days of production support, with ad-hoc weekend support, to seven-day operations.  This job includes regular holiday and weekend support for the critical Enterprise Accounting System (EASy) and Account Management Information (AMI)....The CATS Production Support Team supports the 12 Reserve Bank Accounting Operations, Federal Reserve Financial Services (FRFS) and external Financial Institutions.  In support of these important responsibilities this position plays a lead role in performing and coordinating the following activities:...This position requires regular weekend and holiday work to support 7-day operations...2nd shift hours 3:00 pm - 11:00 pm, 10% shift.differential...Daily System Monitoring of EASy & AMI Online & Batch ProcessesInbound and Outbound File and Report MonitoringIncident Response Management (Collaborating with CATS Development, NIT & Stakeholders)Contingency Planning and SupportBusiness Resumption TestingData Center RotationsSecurity Assurance for the Federal Reserve (SAFR) Compliance DocumentationSecurity Assessments and AccreditationsProduction Business Line TestingProduction Support with Business LinesInternal and External Technical Audits ResponseCustomer Phone Support/Problem ResolutionEmail (SMB) Support/Problem ResolutionShared Responsibility for 12 Companies Daily Close ProcessesGenerating ReportsLate General Ledger & Other Key Business FunctionsLeading the effort to learn and implement new monitoring technology with the transition to the Cloud PlatformParticipate on, and contribute to, System-Level work groups dealing with accounting related applicationsThis position is not required to supervise others...Knowledge & Experience..Knowledge and experience normally acquired through, or equivalent to, the completion of a Bachelor's degree in business or technology and a minimum of 5 years of job-related experience including work with technology such as SQL, Linux, AIX and Shell ScriptingExperience working in a Cloud Environment is desirable...For this job, any offer of employment is contingent upon successfully passing a two-phase security screening. The first phase consists of the satisfactory completion of a physical examination (including a drug screening), reference checks, and a security investigation consisting of credit and criminal history checks....The second phase, which might not be complete until after you begin working at the Reserve Bank, is an additional risk-based security screening determined by the risk rating of the position.  Depending upon the sensitivity of the position, this phase may include, and is not limited to, work and residency eligibility verification, and personal interviews with the candidate, references, and prior employers....All applicants must have resided in the United States for at least three (3) years...The Federal Reserve Bank is committed to a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace and to provide equal employment opportunities to all persons without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, genetic information, disability, or military service....The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work required of this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities or skills associated with this position or the personnel so classified. While this job description is intended to be an accurate reflection of this position, management reserves the right to revise this or any job description at its discretion at any time....Full Time / Part Time..Full time...Regular / Temporary..Regular...Job Exempt (Yes / No)..Yes...Job Category...Work Shift..Second (United States of America)...The Federal Reserve Banks believe that diversity and inclusion among our employees is critical to our success as an organization, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. The Federal Reserve Banks are committed to equal employment opportunity for employees and job applicants in compliance with applicable law and to an environment where employees are valued for their differences....Privacy Notice

11:00 pm, 10% shift differential- Daily System Monitoring of EASy & AMI Online & Batch Processes- Inbound and Outbound File and Report Monitoring- Incident Response Management (Collaborating with CATS Development, NIT & Stakeholders)- Contingency Planning and Support- Business Resumption Testing- Data Center Rotations- Security Assurance for the Federal Reserve (SAFR) Compliance Documentation- Security Assessments and Accreditations- Production Business Line Testing- Production Support with Business Lines- Internal and External Technical Audits Response- Customer Phone Support/Problem Resolution- Email (SMB) Support/Problem Resolution- Shared Responsibility for 12 Companies Daily Close Processes- Generating Reports- Late General Ledger & Other Key Business Functions- Leading the effort to learn and implement new monitoring technology with the transition to the Cloud Platform- Participate on, and contribute to, System-Level work groups dealing with accounting related applications- Knowledge and experience normally acquired through, or equivalent to, the completion of a Bachelor's degree in business or technology and a minimum of 5 years of job-related experience including work with technology such as SQL, Linux, AIX and Shell Scripting- Experience working in a Cloud Environment is desirable- Successful completion of a two-phase security screening, including physical examination, reference checks, and a security investigation consisting of credit and criminal history checks- All applicants must have resided in the United States for at least three (3) years.

### Job_Dedcrip:
Job Title: Principal Software Engineer, Platform.Location: Remote but must live in MST or PST time zones.Years of Experience: 8+.Reports to: Sr. Director, Software Engineering.A career thatâs the whole package!.At Conga, weâve built a community where our colleagues can thrive. Â Here youâll find opportunities to innovate, support for growth through individual and team development, and an environment where all voices can be heard..Conga crushes complexity within an increasingly complex world. Â With our revenue lifecycle management solution, we transform your unique complexities for order configuration, execution, fulfillment, and contract renewal processes with a single critical insights data model that adapts to ever-changing business requirements and aligns the understanding and efforts of every team..Our mission: Empower customers to deliver transformational revenue growth by aligning teams, processes, and technology to maximize customer lifetime value..Our approach is grounded in the Conga Way, a framework for what we stand for and everything we do as an organization â from hiring to decision making and product development. Developed with direct input from our colleagues, the Conga Way is the foundation for our culture..A quick snapshotâ¦.Do you prefer working with a group of people who are driven to solve interesting problems at scale? Â Are you looking for an engineering position servicing the needs of the customers and at the same time growing your skillsets? Â Do you want to help build and support high scale production code in a multi-tenant SaaS Platform? Â The Platform Services team is a tightly integrated team serving the foundational platform componentsâ¦we architect, build, run, and support all the internal system and services that run Revenue lifecycle management cloud..Why itâs a big dealâ¦.We are looking for a talented Principal Software Engineer to help us build next generation Conga Revenue Cloud Platform.Â  This is a great opportunity for someone who is looking to use his or her expertise in development as a member of a dynamic team that designs, develops, tests, and maintains the Conga platform.Â  We want to hire unbelievably bright developers, who are a joy to work with, love to work with others, solve problems, listen well, and lead as appropriate.Â  We believe in using the best tools for the task at hand so the ability and desire to learn new programming languages and technologies is a must. All of this adds up to an exciting, challenging, and always interesting place to work, where hard problems are found and solved every day..Are you the person weâre looking for?.Education. Â Successful completion of a Bachelor of Computer Science, or an Engineering degree is highly preferred and 8+ years of experience in .NET and C# with the drive to learn and progress in the technical skill and nuanced art of development work within an Agile environment..Take ownership. Â To architect, build and scale Cloud agnostic platforms..Build.Â  Code that is high-quality, clean, scalable, performant and reusable by enforcing software engineering best practices and back-end micro-services from scratch, working with containers and Kubernetes..Participate.Â  In an agile team lifecycle, including design, development, testing, planning, backlog grooming and support..Work with.Â  Product owners and architects to understand detailed requirements and own the code from design, development to test automation..Perform. Â As a trusted contributor demonstrating the ability to meet deadlines, exceed goals, and create benchmarks for success, you will require little to no supervision..Development.Â  Demonstrated success executing development work within an Agile. Environment..Exposure.Â  To cloud architecture, cloud design patterns, AWS/Azure cloud technologies..Hereâs what will give you an edgeâ¦ Experience. Â Working with AWS/Azure cloud technologies; exposure to cloud architecture and cloud design patterns; and, last but not least, experience working with NoSQL DBâs and Elastic search..Strong communication and interpersonal skills.Â Youâre comfortable initiating and engaging in collaborative discussions. ### Job_Dedcrip:
The Aerospace Corporation is the trusted partner to the nation's space programs, solving the hardest problems and providing unmatched technical expertise. As the operator of a federally funded research and development center (FFRDC), we are broadly engaged across all aspects of space- delivering innovative solutions that span satellite, launch, ground, and cyber systems for defense, civil and commercial customers. When you join our team, you'll be part of a special collection of problem solvers, thought leaders, and innovators. Join us and take your place in space....At Aerospace, we are committed to providing an inclusive and diverse workplace for all employees to share in our common passion and aspiration - to carry out a mission much bigger than ourselves....The.Innovation Lab (iLab).Systems Architect.will serve as the technical lead for multiple architecture design studies to evaluate operational impact of technologies under development. You will use the results of these studies, as well as other analyses, to document potential technology use cases and associated technical requirements for a given technology. Additionally, s/he will be responsible for leading the development of technology roadmaps for technologies within the iLab technical investment portfolios....The Innovation Lab is a part of the Office of the Chief Technology Officer (OCTO) and manages Research & Development (R&D) investment portfolios associated with bringing transformative or disruptive technologies to maturity. iLab also provides services, platforms, and programs that enable collaboration and impactful innovation across the corporation. We are seeking a creative and dynamic Systems Architect to lead assessments of operational impact of new technologies under development within the iLab technical investment portfolio....This is a full-time position in a hybrid work model with locations available in El Segundo, CA....What You'll Be Doing..Leading concurrent engineering design sessions to assess technology infusion impactProviding Systems Engineering and Systems Architecting assessments for establishing use cases for new technologiesEstablishing and leading engineering and scientist teams, across multiple divisions and geographic locations, to conduct analyses, research, and experiments necessary to demonstrate the viability and impact of new technologiesGenerating Technology RoadmapsDeveloping and tracking technical requirements for new technologies based on use casesConsolidating assessments, analyses, and requirements into technical reports and promotional materialsProvide regular communications with management and customers regarding technology use cases and roadmaps...What You Need to be Successful...Minimum Requirements:..Master's degree in a STEM field or equivalent is requiredTypically, (8) years of applicable professional or educational experience is requiredExperience in Space Systems Engineering or Space Systems ArchitectingSkills in team-building, technical influence, budget and resource planning, and mentoringAbility to translate detailed technical information to relatable material for a broader audienceExperience building technology roadmapsWillingness to travel (approx. two trips per month) and to work off-business hours to support customer needsThis position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI security clearance, which is issued by the U.S. government. U.S. citizenship is required to obtain a security clearance...How You Can Stand Out...It would be impressive if you have one or more of these:..PhD in a STEM field or equivalent is preferableDirect experience leading concurrent engineering design projectsExperience building relationships across Aerospace engineering and program office organizationsProven experience in managing dynamic budgets and project allocationsBroad knowledge of Aerospace support to customer...We offer a competitive compensation package where you'll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business.  The grade-based pay range for this job is listed below.  Individual salaries within that range are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge and skills....(Min - Mid - Max)..$105,000 - $140,000 - $185,000...Ways We Reward Our Employees...During your interview process, our team will provide details of our industry-leading benefits....Benefits vary and are applicable based on Job Type.  A few highlights include:..Comprehensive health care and wellness plansPaid holidays, sick time, and vacationStandard and alternate work schedules, including telework options401(k) Plan - Employees receive a total company-paid benefit of 8%, 10%, or 12% of eligible compensation based on years of service and matching contributions; employees are immediately eligible and vested in the plan upon hireFlexible spending accountsVariable pay program for exceptional contributionsRelocation assistanceProfessional growth and development programs to help advance your careerEducation assistance programsAn inclusive work environment built on teamwork, flexibility, and respect...We are all unique, from diverse backgrounds and all walks of life, yet one thing bonds all of us to each other-the belief that we can make a difference. This core belief empowers us to do our best work at The Aerospace Corporation....Equal Opportunity Commitment...The Aerospace Corporation is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We believe that a diverse workforce creates an environment in which unique ideas are developed and differing perspectives are valued, producing superior customer solutions. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, color, religion, genetic information, marital status, ancestry, national origin, protected veteran status, physical disability, medical condition, mental disability, or disability status and any other characteristic protected by state or federal law. If you're an individual with a disability or a disabled veteran who needs assistance using our online job search and application tools or need reasonable accommodation to complete the job application process, please contact us by phone at 310.336.5432 or by email at  ieo.mailbox@aero.org . You can also review Know Your Rights : Workplace Discrimination is Illegal , as well as the  Pay Transparency Policy Statement .

### Response:
output: Job Requirements:- Master's degree in a STEM field or equivalent is required- Typically, (8) years of applicable professional or educational experience is required- Experience in Space Systems Engineering or Space Systems Architecting- Skills in team-building, technical influence, budget and resource planning, and mentoring- Ability to translate detailed technical information to relatable material for a broader audience- Experience building technology roadmaps- Willingness to travel (approx. two trips per month) and to work off-business hours to support customer needs- This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI security clearance, which is issued by the U.S. government. U.S. citizenship is required to obtain a security clearance.

queues per Surge Plan Procedures......Requirements:...QUALIFICATIONS:...Required (Minimum) Qualifications  Education, Certification, Experience, and Skills...* 1-2 years experience in technical Help Desk environment....* 1-2 years experience working within an Active Directory environment...* 1-2 years experience in troubleshooting issues with a modern Windows operating system...* 1-2 years drives, power supplies, and motherboards....* Ability to support the following:...* Lenovo customer equipment...* MS Windows 7 or 10...* MS Office 2010 or higher...* Standalone, networked and Multi-Functional Device printers...* Cisco telephones...* Smartphones (iPhone and Android)...* Remote access technology including: DirectAccess, VMWare, VPN, etc....* AirWatch or equivalent mobile device management...* System Center...* As well as:...* Excellent oral and written communication skills....* Excellent phone etiquette....* Strong technical aptitude including excellent troubleshooting skills....* Ability to work with users that have limited technical knowledge....* Ability to instruct users utilizing verbal communication....* Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment....* Ability to interface with all levels of management....* Excellent time management, scheduling, and organizational skills....* Ability to work well independently or in a team setting....* Attention to detail....* High degree of patience....Preferred Qualifications  Education, Certification, Experience, Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities...* Experience maintaining inventory of hardware and communicating with upper management when needed...* Experience performing inventory exercises/audits...* Experience in tracking assets through their lifespan...* Ability to provide event Support (A/V, Skype, Recording)...* Experience in providing technical support and onsite assistance for events...* Ability to coordinate with the host of an event to fulfill their technical needs with the tools provided by the government client...* Experience resolving issues for mission-critical staff members (VIPs)...* Experience with Mersive/Solstice...CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:...Candidate must hold active Peace Corps clearance..

Job ID: 2218181...Location:.HUNTSVILLE , AL , US...Date Posted:.2023-01-02...Category:.Engineering and Sciences...Subcategory:.Systems Engineer...Schedule:.Full-time...Shift:.Day Job...Travel:.Yes, 10 % of the Time...Minimum Clearance Required:.Secret...Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain:.TS/SCI...Potential for Remote Work:.No...Description......Description:.....Make a difference for national security by leading a team of dedicated professionals in supporting the Space Development Agency (SDA) in developing and deploying the Battle Management Command, Control, and Communications (BMC3) software development and hosting environment for the National Defense Space Architecture (NDSA). These systems establish software development capabilities to securely and rapidly field mission applications developed by BMC3 ecosystem participants in support of Joint All Domain Command and Control (JADC2) objectives.....SAIC has an immediate need for a Field Service Engineer with software (SW) & hardware (HW) development, integration, operations and maintenance experience for space and ground systems. We are looking for an innovative and motivated individual to be SAIC's on-site representative to plan and execute testing, training, maintenance, and operate the BMC3 ground hardware and support NDSA operators. Our chosen representative work with the SDA operations team to assess, test and onboard code developed in legacy or external environments such that it meets the requirements for integration and deployment in the BMC3 ecosystem. Candidates must have experience with planning, executing and testing software developmental programs with demonstrated ability to lead the software development team in support of program management to meet customer milestones......Primary responsibilities include.:...The SDA BMC3 AppFac Field Service Engineer will support application development teams initiating their development within the AppFac (on-site) by guiding and assisting the BMC3 application developers in establishing DevSecOps tool pipelines.   Assess, test and onboard BMC3 application development teams that use other development environments assess, test, and onboard code so that it meets the security standards necessary for integration and deployment on BMC3.   Plan and execute testing, training, maintenance, operation of the BMC3 ground hardware and support NDSA operators at the SDA SNOC.   Support BMC3 Ecosystem DevSecOps CI/CD from the SDA SNOCs.   Operate the BMC3 Ground Hardware and BMC3 applications.   Perform testing of applications in Canary Operation.   Support SDA O&I and coordinate with BMC3 Application Developers during BMC3 Application anomaly response.   Creating and executing test plans and procedures, performing data collection and analysis, and authoring test reports as required to support BMC3 AppFac, s/w and h/w testing   Provides inputs into the labor, schedules, equipment and s/w required for testing   Developing and briefing data packages that provide analysis results to inform the government decision-makers.   Collaborating with prime contractors, other team contractors, government civilians, and members of the Space Development Agency and U.S. Space Force....Qualifications......Required Experience, Skills and Attributes:....Bachelor's Degree and fourteen plus (14+); Master's Degree and twelve plus (12+); PhD or JD and nine plus (9+) years of experience with systems engineering and test experience in space, ground, operations and sustainment segments of DoD, NSA, or NRO programs.   Proven delivery record with Systems engineering, testing, and integration experience with hardware and software systems.   Strong interpersonal skills to enable working, interfacing, and interrelating with diverse personnel and dynamic teams.   Experienced at self-starting, seeking solutions, and works well in a team environment   Demonstrated experience working with Space Force/Air Force/DoD customers in an acquisition environment, with space and/or ground systems.   Excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as organizational and interpersonal skills.   Familiarity with cloud-based systems, operating systems, databases, networking, firewalls, Network Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS) and host-based IDS and IPS.    Desired Qualifications:    Active Top Secret clearance with SCI eligibility   Advanced Degree in Science, Engineering or Math....Covid Policy: SAIC does not require COVID-19 vaccinations or boosters. Customer site vaccination requirements must be followed when work is performed at a customer site.SAICÂ® is a premier Fortune 500Â® technology integrator driving our nation's technology transformation. Our robust portfolio of offerings across the defense, space, civilian, and intelligence markets includes secure high-end solutions in engineering, digital, artificial intelligence, and mission solutions. Using our expertise and understanding of existing and emerging technologies, we integrate the best components from our own portfolio and our partner ecosystem to deliver innovative, effective, and efficient solutions that are critical to achieving our customers' missions....We are approximately 26,000 strong; driven by mission, united by purpose, and inspired by opportunities. SAIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer, fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion , which is core to our values and important to attract and retain exceptional talent. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, SAIC has annual revenues of approximately $7.4 billion. For more information, visit saic.com . For ongoing news, please visit our newsroom ...My SAIC Benefits.
